definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

sentences.english: First is concern over the implications of Summers' ouster for an incoming president.
sentences.chinese: 首先是對驅逐薩莫斯校長迎來新校長的擔憂。

sentences.english: The police hustled the tramps out of town .
sentences.chinese: 警察驅逐遊民離開城市。

sentences.english: I was the lion who drove the jackals from you while you slept.
sentences.chinese: 我就是在你睡熟時替你驅逐豺狼的那頭獅子。

sentences.english: We declare him anathematized and excommunicated and we judge him condemned to eternal fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們宣告他被詛咒及驅逐出教，並斷定他不得永生。

sentences.english: He was declared persona non grata and thrown out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他被這個國家宣佈爲不受歡迎的人並被驅逐出境。

sentences.english: The UNSC fleet MAC rounds impacted on the Covenant destroyer.
sentences.chinese: UNSC艦隊的MAC炮彈衝擊着聖約人的驅逐艦。

sentences.english: It was God, not the sword or the bow, that drove out the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 是上帝將敵人驅逐而不是刀和弓。

sentences.english: The United States Navy destroyer Barry fired Tomahawk missiles from the Mediterranean Sea on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 週六，美國海軍驅逐艦巴里從地中海發射戰斧導彈。

sentences.english: The destroyer sliced through the water.
This mental imagery rehearsal by exorcising the fear and finally dispel the nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的心理想象練習可以驅逐恐懼，最終消除噩夢。

sentences.english: The captain dived his submarine deep to escape from the destroyers.
sentences.chinese: 海軍上校使他的潛艇深深下潛以逃避驅逐艇。

sentences.english: He was declared a heretic, and excommunicated from the Church.
sentences.chinese: 他被宣佈爲異教徒，並被驅逐出教會。

sentences.english: He also criticised the evictions for being violent and ruthless .
sentences.chinese: 他也批評這些驅逐暴力無情。

sentences.english: The leftist leader already had expelled the U.S. ambassador six months earlier.
sentences.chinese: 早在六個月前左派領導人已經把美國大使驅逐出境。

sentences.english: Shenzhen, the Chinese People’s Liberation Army’s naval destroyer, entered Tokyo Bay.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民解放軍的深圳號驅逐艦進入了東京港。

definition: to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
an execution/to put sb to death
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
